Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2008 08:47PM Pat16 wrote: I have been diagnosed with high grade intraductal carcinoma and go for surgery on the 23rd. Talk about being scared.  If the pathology comes back positive I go through another surgery in 2 weeks after that to remove lympnodes.  I get to have radiation therapy, I don't know how much.  I have not told my boyfriend.  I am to scared to tell people.  I am afraid they will treat my like I have a plague or something or not want to come around me any  more.  So I pretend life is wonderful.
Posts.Title: JUST DIAGNOSED-SCARED SILLY! wildfilee carolsd

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2008 11:14AM Pat16 wrote: I am new to this forum thing.  Wildfilee, I feel just like you, only difference is my life wasn't full of disabilities, but no breaks.  I finally reached a time now where it is my turn to live and was working on that just moved in by myself, no kids, no cold hearted fiancee.  I was on  my  way, then I got blind sided with this cancer.  I have other pains I am afraid to even acknowledge for fear the cancer is spreading.  I lost my brother and a good friend last year to cancer.  I was by my brothers side when he passed on, it was so heartbreaking.  We had talked a lot in those days before his  passing.  I seen the pain he went through with all the chemo, radiation etc.  I don't want to go through that.  As I sit here tears rolling down my face, I guess I should count my blessings.  I feel like I have been to  hell and back and I am going back for a second trip.  I asked God if there is a lesson I am suppose to be learning please show me so I can get on with it.  I question did I really hurt someone and I am being  punished for it..  So many questions of why.  I have always  been a christian, not always going to church or anything, but always  prayed for my children, friends, etc.  I feel so alone now...I keep my sense of humor though.. its all I have left at this point to get me through.  Only  my partners know where I work and they are great, but they are starting to treat me differently, can't explain it.  Just sense it.  Not in a bad way though.  I just want to be treated  normal, not like I am different.  It is just starting to kick in that I have cancer, I guess I feel if I ignore it don't acknowlege it, maybe the lab made a mistake, that it will go away.
